CatDescriptText: Mr. Myron Seigal, coffee shop owner, Downtown Pittsburgh, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think taverns should be permitted to remain open and dispense alcohol beverages until at least 2 A.M. Sundays? Do you favor the sale of beer and wine on Sundays in Pennsylvania, like some other states permit?" answer reads: "Yes, I think so.  Why not?  If people want this and some of them do, why not give it to them?  As for the sales of beer and wines on Sunday, I think that should be left up to a vote of the people."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Myron or Meyron Seigal wearing tweed suit jacket and dark fedora with light colored band, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
